result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gabriel A Guzman Castillo

records.addlTxt: Court Reinstated Signature Bond and other conditions of bails remain in place.

Defendant Gabriel A Guzman Castillo in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case recalled at 3:46pm. Defendant appear. Defense moves to vacate the Bench Warrant and Reinstate Bail.
Granted by the Court. Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing date.
Order to Cancel Warrant forwarded to the Judge  Case remains calendared in Branch 19.
Plea and Sentencing scheduled November 30, 2022 at 10:30am.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of $1000.00

Defendant Gabriel A Guzman Castillo not in court.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Gabriel A Guzman Castillo.  Attorney Erika Strebel in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Calendar call.
Defendant fail to appear for today hearing.
Court order bail to be forfeited and Bench warrant issued.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Gabriel A Guzman Castillo not in court. Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Gabriel A Guzman Castillo. Attorney Erika Strebel in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing. Defense counsel has no explanation for defendant's non-appearance. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date. Court orders case adjourned for calendar call to Branch 19. Calendar call scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to plea questionnaire/waiver of rights

Jury instructions for plea hearing

Defendant Gabriel A Guzman Castillo in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing date. Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Gabriel A Guzman Castillo in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent; both appear by video.  Annie Louk appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Cudahy Officer A. Wege.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, Filed.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No driving without a valid license and state required insurance.
Court ordered the cash bail to be returned to the remitter.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Gabriel A Guzman Castillo in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant. ($2,500.00) LW
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 2500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Gabriel A Guzman Castillo not in court.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.

Actual Date Bond Posted with the Sheriffs Department:
03/08/22.    22RM013407
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/13/22 @ 2p
